name: Tomato Basil Soup
description: Classic Italian roasted tomato soup with fresh basil. Aromatic, creamy, and comforting.

instructions.instruction: Wash tomatoes and cut in half. Place cut-side up on a large baking sheet.
instructions.tip: Don't crowd them - they need space to roast properly.

instructions.instruction: Scatter chopped onions and carrots around the tomatoes.
Drizzle 3 tbsp olive oil over vegetables. Season with salt and pepper.
Roast for 45-50 minutes until tomatoes are soft and slightly caramelized.
instructions.tip: Rotate pan halfway for even roasting.

instructions.instruction: Heat remaining olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic, cook 1 minute.
instructions.tip: Don't burn garlic - it becomes bitter.

instructions.instruction: Add tomato paste, cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Transfer roasted vegetables and all juices to the pot.
instructions.tip: Scrape up caramelized bits from pan - that's flavor gold!

instructions.instruction: Add broth, balsamic vinegar, and thyme sprigs. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat, simmer 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove thyme sprigs. Add most basil leaves (save some for garnish).
Blend until completely smooth with immersion blender or regular blender.
instructions.tip: Be careful blending hot liquids - leave lid slightly open.

instructions.instruction: Add sugar and taste. Adjust salt and pepper as needed.
Stir in cream if using. Garnish with fresh basil and serve.

tips: Best made with fresh, ripe summer tomatoes.
Roasting brings out tomatoes' natural sweetness.
For vegan, skip cream or use coconut cream.
Soup tastes even better the next day - flavors meld.
In winter, canned San Marzano tomatoes work well.
servingSuggestion: Pairs perfectly with grilled cheese sandwich. Drizzle with olive oil and fresh basil.
variations: Spicy: Add red pepper flakes or cayenne.
Coconut: Replace cream with coconut milk - vegan and exotic.
